result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:52 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 21CF564, 21CF1448, 21CF1551, 22CF347, and 22CF757.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde for DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for a Review Hearing. VRCW.

COURT reviews attorney's status with defendant.
Defendant makes statement. Wishes to be represented.
ADA Hannah Runde notes time limits will need to be addressed.
COURT addresses Defendant regarding time limits.
Defendant makes statement.  Requests Speedy Trial on all files.  
COURT makes statement regarding modifying the cash bond into a signature bond.
ADA Runde objects to bond modification.

COURT makes findings.
COURT modifies bond from a $1,000.00 cash bond to a $5,000.00 signature bond to cover all files.  All non-monetary conditions to remain the same. 
COURT denies appointing an attorney at county expense. Defendant qualifies to SPD appointment. 
COURT finds good cause tolls time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.
